thread.title: H.S. football games to watch - Football
thread.title_full: H.S. football games to watch - Football - NorthJersey.com

author: The Record
title: H.S. football games to watch - Football
text:
Football games to watch 
TODAY
No. 7 Ramapo (3-1) at No. 6 Wayne Hills (4-1), 7
Story line: Ramapo, which has lost only to top-ranked NV/Old Tappan, can secure valuable power points in North 1, Group 3 by beating its rival on the road. Wayne Hills must contain Ramapo senior QB Keith Woetzel (six TD passes, 229 rushing yards, five rushing TDs) if the Patriots are to bounce back from their first loss of the season, a 23-20 defeat at No. 2 Pascack Valley. 
The pick: Wayne Hills
No. 4 Paramus Catholic (1-3)at No. 2 Don Bosco (3-1), 7
Story line: The loaded Paladins expected to return to the Non-Public Group 4 championship game this season, yet find themselves fighting for one of eight spots in their bracket. They'll try to avoid a third straight loss. The Ironmen have won three straight following a season-opening loss at No. 1 St. Joseph, and are coming off a bye.
The pick: Don Bosco
No. 12 Indian Hills (4-0)at No. 1 NV/Old Tappan (4-0), 6 
Story line: The Braves, winners of eight straight, have been one of the best turnaround stories of the fall, and can claim sole possession of first place in the Big North National Division with an upset. The trick will be stopping the high-octane NV/OT offense, which is averaging a North Jersey-best 49.8 points.
The pick: NV/Old Tappan
No. 3 Bergen Catholic (3-2) at No. 5 DePaul (1-3), 8 
Story line: How will the new-look Bergen Catholic offense perform in front of a national TV audience on ESPNU? Sophomore Johnny Langan, playing in his hometown of Wayne tonight, and junior Patrick Holly are expected to see time at quarterback after Tennessee-bound senior QB Jarrett Guarantano suffered what is likely a season-ending foot injury. DePaul has not won a Big North United game since beating the Crusaders on Oct. 11, 2013 (0-6 since).
The pick: Bergen Catholic
No. 5 Mahwah (4-0) at Ramsey (3-1), 7
Story line: This is one of North Jersey's best rivalry games, and this season it carries some serious North 1, Group 2 playoff implications. The Rams have won three straight to establish themselves as a contender, but they will have their hands full trying to stop a James Ciliento-led offense that has averaged 45 points.
The pick: Mahwah
No. 13 Boonton (4-0) at North Warren (4-0), 7
Story line: Boonton's players are confident a week after ending a nine-game losing streak against perennial Morris County power Mountain Lakes that began in 2006. Boonton, led by versatile senior QB/S Gage Cabalar (532 rushing yards, eight TDs) and senior LB David Koval (team-leading 47 tackles), has scored 38 points or more in three of its four games. North Warren has allowed just 6.3 points per game and shut out two of its opponents.
The pick: Boonton
Becton (3-1) at No. 14 Cresskill (3-1), 7
